game，讲述了一个虚拟与现实结合，信任与爱想伴的故事。②游戏的元素极为丰富，极为有趣，本来以为是一个进化之地或者史丹利寓言一样的游戏，但玩下来才发现游戏元素多的夸张，而且对多款游戏或游戏类型进行了致敬吐槽。游戏的游戏元素包括 修改游戏本身玩法机制的类型游戏再创造，史丹利寓言一样的旁白与玩家动作选择相互动，基本ui与玩法相结合的轻解密，不同游戏功能元素间的互动解密，点击类手游（有一章是对塞尔达的rpg元素的致敬和吐槽，修改本身机制，下一章则直接将其变成一个free2play，也是体验最枯燥的部分，真的和手游一样的设计，但是多了很多机制修改，各种吐槽f2p是灾难）。甚至我最喜欢的，游戏还加入了音乐元素与游戏元素相结合，比如音乐歌词元素对游戏玩法进行吐槽或过关暗示，在结尾部分甚至有制作者的真人演出，玩了一出虚拟与现实的科幻剧。光列举游戏元素就这么一大章，完全可见游戏元素的丰富性。换做一年前的自己，绝对不会给这个游戏好评，是制作组的坚持和诚意深深的打动了我。一年以来，制作组一直在打磨这款游戏，一步一步的消除了孽刃不稳定的硬直、忏悔者诡异的伤害判定范围、浪费大量时间的跑图机制、喜欢卡墙角和蹲楼梯的怪物、时不时触发的各种恶性BUG，将渎神从一个问题多多的游戏变成了一个正常偏优良的游戏，而且最新的DLC还在本来就非常完美的艺术风格上更进一步，添加了更多精美的动画和精致的景观，而且这一切的努力都是免费的！不可谓不良心！目前的渎神仍旧是不完美的，但是有这样的良心制作组在，我一点也不担心渎神及其续作的未来。它一定会变得更好①这款游戏是我今年玩过的所有新游戏中，最有趣，游戏元素最丰富的作品。游戏将gameplay进行变化，将一个惹人生厌的game（旁白）和玩家捆绑在一起，经过了一个个游戏的冒险，最终彼此联系交互，从there 73299471.review:
《怪物猎人：世界》8.7/10

这是系列里第一款同时登陆主机与PC的“老牌”游戏，也是第一款全高清化，并且销量过千万的“新”怪猎。同时还是本人接触的第一款怪猎，所以接下来只是不去横向对比的评测本作。

[h1]怪物与猎人之间不得不说的故事：[/h1]
每次在战斗前的CG都给足了怪物面子，各种凶狠的特写镜头，配乐辉煌大气，整体气势感十足。至于为什么我们打小怪兽？通过剧情CG我们可以了解，在本作的世界观里其实一直在强调和平，玩家所杀的都是破坏生态的怪物。主线任务与支线任务基本都是打怪，可以组队进行，玩家可以用十几种不同的武器去战斗，每一种武器都有自己独特的攻击方式，打击感各不相同，也不逊色。任务完成之后，玩家可以得到造型各异但是符合怪物外形的服装，或者让自己变得更强的材料，这些材料可以用在防具与武器上。如果你没朋友，那么你可以在任务里发送“求救信号”，一支穿云箭，千军万马来相见，立马就会有真实的大佬前来相助，完全不用担心剧情任务打一半过不去这种问题，就算当成单机，一个人玩也可以通关。

[h1]元气满满的画面与交互：[/h1]
很多时候在画面风格都能看到日漫的影子，比如在游戏开始时，你会有一只可以自定义皮肤的猫人同伴，它会经常卖萌，以及玩家“补充体力”用餐时夸张的CG…画质方面看上去有点年代感是因为卡普空用的是老引擎，而不是近两年才研发出的RE，但这其实不妨碍画面风格与世界观融合在一起没有违和感，并且商店里还有4K清晰度的材质包可以下载。开始创建角色捏脸时，我男女角色都试过，认为女角色更容易捏的好看，于是我捏了一个妹子，进游戏后我感觉社交元素做的不错，有很多诙谐幽默的动作可以向你的队友传达，包括一些快捷语和贴图，可以让你和你的朋友联机刷怪之余轻松搞笑。

[h1]美中不足：[/h1]
探索整个游戏世界时，虽说打开大地图，看着无缝连接，可惜几个大区域并没有“真正”连接在一起，表面上看是抓住飞龙的脚被传送到各个区域：“快速旅行”，然而是否省略传送过程应该由玩家决定，而不是没做出来，然后演变成一种逻辑自洽，从而使玩家形成一种代入方面的断裂感。本作的代号为“世界”，然而开放世界方面却做的不够彻底，如果是其他主题也许我不会那么在乎这种事情。
不过值得高兴的是，很多区域都有自己鲜明的视觉风格，有雪地有沙漠有丛林......并且每个区域至少有上中下三个层级。新鲜感制造得不错。并且在怪物的“世界”里面的生态环境营造得很用心，猎人落泪。

[code][b]亮点：[/b]
+非战斗情况下的氛围营造得很轻松
+风格各异，不失美感的武器与防具
+怪物出场CG令人印象深刻
+冰原DLC诚意十足

[b]不足：[/b]
-只能“快速旅行“的“世界”
-剧情有些牵强，主角全程工具人[/code]

[h1]总评：[/h1]
本作可以说是近几年的联机共斗游戏里让人眼前一亮的独特存在：鲜明的二次元风格与出色的打击手感，再加上富有创意的世界观，目前为止业界独一份，来尝一口？

72529659.review:
With the release of Alatreon it has officially been 10 years since I picked up my first Monster Hunter game and if it wasn't clear enough by the amount of hours I have on PC alone, I am very in love with MHW. With that being said I would hope that I am more than capable of giving some insight on my experience with MHW as a whole.


Firstly. The developers deserve all the praise in the world for releasing a great game brimming with tangible content. Ever since release they have also been consistently updating the game with new exciting monsters, weapons, armor, etc. for free! They have also been continuing to do so after the release of the Iceborne expansion several months ago, which alone had already doubled the amount of in-game content. A lot of triple-A titles these days charge you absurd amounts of money for extremely small content packages with little to no support following afterwards. This isn't even mentioning the small fact that MHW's cosmetic DLCs don't make you feel obligated to buy them when comparing them to the cosmetics that the base game has to offer.

Being the first world-wide Monster Hunter to release on all major platforms, there is without a doubt a handful of things the devs have not handled perfectly following its release. The major killer being co-op in the early game, primarily just for the story quests which normally only last a few hours anyway. I for one think the story should be handled alone for the most part so new players can steadily learn and adapt to the game to avoid frustration in the future. Besides that I still do encourage seeking guidance from veteran players when needed without ruining the game's experience. I myself have helped dozens of friends in the past learn the game because I knew it was entirely worth the effort.
With all that being said MHW is indeed an objectively grindy game on paper when you really start to sink your teeth into it. As with a lot of games there's an expected level of tedium when it comes to any kind of grinding. Regardless, as with every good game, there is always some sort of repitition to be had in it's own right. The game is only ever "grindy" if the player makes it so. Yes there are times where new players will have to take things slow but for the most part anyone can just casually progress through the majority of the game without any huge stops(Depending on the player of course). There is always something meaningful or important to do regardless if it has anything to do with grinding. However if you're the type of person who does enjoy min-maxing gear or heavily personalizing your play-style then it's a very rewarding grind if you put yourself through it. Hence all the players who enjoy the game.

Moving on. The game offers the player 14 different diverse weapon classes to freely choose from. Some weapons are easy to learn but have higher mechanical skill ceilings, while others are more technically complex but are easier to master, some just outright more stylish than others. Armor can be mixed and matched to your liking to provide different skills and abilities to help further personalize your play-style, whether it's situational skills or "comfy" skills. All of this on top of the game's straightforward yet beautifully in-depth character customization at the start of the game(Which is permanent unless you pay a couple cents to re-edit your physical character). Also I'd like to mention that even though there is a clearly defined meta when it comes to dealing damage in this game, the vast majority of the hunters who abide by these ideals are mostly all bark and no bite. You can't do damage if you're already dead. Therefore I strongly encourage everyone to play the way they want as long as it helps them survive.

Speaking of death. In regards to frustrations with the harder content, every single quest in the game runs on a timer... I think it's perfectly fine if the devs want to give a couple of endgame monsters damage checks. The game was never meant to be easy. The game gives the player literal solutions to every problem in the entire game. It's just up to the players themselves to step out of their comfort zones to prepare for and overcome them all(Alatreon is not as hard as people make it seem). The only real penalty for death is the loss of used items, time, and reduced quest rewards assuming the player can actually complete the quest. Nothing too hardcore here.

On a small tangent for active players. There have been lots of frustrations stemming from the newly introduced clutch claw mechanics. While I do believe the clutch claw is a perfect addition to MHW it was executed horribly. I feel the best way to implement these mechanics would be to have all weapons soften in one clutch but to allow certain normal attacks from slower weapons to straight-up soften or at least prolong the softens when making contact.

Gameplay is insurmountable. When animations and sound design are done as good as this, it goes completely unnoticed and even taken for granted at times. Everything happening in the game feels so real and natural. Monsters have intention, weapons have believable weight to them, and the player characters make everything they do seem deliberate. Other games slowly lead you to a climax in which they grant a reward after. Where as MHW is one of those games where the climax is the reward, but that's the secret of MHW, you're always at the climax. Every second is a fight for your life yet also a display of power and finesse. A truly intense back-and-forth of instinct and endurance of whether or not you or the monster tires out first. All of that isn't even including the best part. The experience of fighting alongside other hunters. You see a lower-level hunter struggling so you offer them help and then cross paths with them, better than they were, in the future. Or you see another hunter using the same weapon as you so it turns into a competition of who's better with the weapon but you both end up completely in sync with your movesets while attacking the monster. Or the monster pins you down and that one annoying teammate who kept knocking you over with his weapon earlier ends up being the one dropping their weapon to save your life.

It's a game. You're supposed to be having fun.
Is all the time you put into having fun with something gone to waste because something else on the surface made you upset with the it at the end of it all?
If this game at all sparks any sort of interest to you and you're willing to go in with a clear and open mind to experience the world of Monster Hunter World. You won't regret it~

EDIT: Sorry for the edits. OCD things~

72618213.review: 歷時1902小時，終於全成就達成，由極貝到煌黑，我們在成長，魔物也在成長，這是一個里程碑，而不是結束，願指引明路的蒼藍星為你們閃耀

72733472.review:
Demorou cerca de 868 horas de jogo pra fazer uma review (sendo 600 delas em um save perdido mas acontece) sobre algo que eu jogo praticamente todo dia, mas vamos lá.
Monster Hunter World é um jogo cooperativo muito bom, simples de aprender mas com detalhes um pouco complexos para todos os tipos de estilos de jogo que o sistema oferece. Vários motivos podem te levar a tentar jogar:
- Você curte pensar em números e encontrar um conjunto que te deixa incrivelmente fortes? O jogo tem
- Você gosta de movimentos exagerados e absurdos que resultam em animações estilosas? Tem também
- Você gosta de bater tão forte em uma criatura 3 ou 4 vezes o seu tamanho que ela cai de madura no chão? O jogo te proporciona um martelo pra isso. Você quer fazer essa mesma coisa mas com ESTILO? - Você pode usar um Berrante Gigante pra fazer isso E mandar ver em umas notas musicais enquanto faz isso.
- Armas corpo-a-corpo não são seu estilo? Acha que isso é algo barbárico de uma gama de edge-lords sem criatividade em um mundo onde tecnologia e armas de fogo dominam o senso comum de combate? Arco e flecha existe mas quem precisa disso quando você pode fazer uso de dois tipos diferentes de armas de fogo que podem disparar rajadas quase infinitas de balas ou se sentir um verdadeiro atirador de elite a ponto de ter que deitar para poder mirar um tiro que vai fazer o pobre coitado que você aceitou caçar explodir, literalmente, da cabeça até a ponta do rabo! (IBAMA pode entrar em contato contigo sobre esse tipo de violência animal, só avisando...)

Puxa saquismo do jogo a parte, mecanicamente o sistema do jogo é bem sólido (apesar da ocasional perda de sessão online mas não é nada que vá te deixar MUITO irritado, ela pode acabar por ter que te obrigar a começar uma missão do zero mas você vai ter que repetir de qualquer jeito para conseguir materiais então tanto faz) e conta com monstros que não só ficam fisicamente mais resistentes e fortes conforme a dificuldade aumenta mas também adquirem novos movimentos que te fazem ficar sempre atento para alguma coisa minimamente diferente no movimento deles, estratégias diversas que você mesmo pode criar de acordo com o seu estilo de jogo e as ferramentas que te são apresentadas que podem ir desde o mais simples DPS absurdo e Tanque imóvel até um misto de DPS com sobrevivência e suporte e uma mistura de Tanque com capacidade de contra ataque e dano acima da média... ou você pode defenestrar a lógica padrão e levar uma arma de fogo gigante com um escudo chumbado na frente e basicamente ser um tanque de guerra de uma só pessoa.

Em questão de história e lore não espere nada MUITO absurdo a menos que você vá caçar a história da série desde o primeiro jogo (o que acaba se revelando uma história um tanto interessante mas igualmente absurda), mas o importante é que você, desbravador heroico, sobe em um barco pra uma ilha desconhecida atrás de monstros gigantes que, depois de destruir o continente onde você e sua raça vivem, inventam de imitar aves e "migrar" para um local até então desconhecido (Um desses monstros é, literalmente, um vulcão). Chegando no dito Novo Mundo você se prepara para conhecer novos cenários exóticos: florestas, desertos, recifes de corais gigantes que pouco tem a ver com água, um cemitério de animais, o paraíso daqueles charlatões que usam terapia com cristais e etc...
Ah, se você por acaso curte RPG e/ou sabe quem é Matthew Mercer, ele é um dos seus superiores na história o que te dá um mínimo de chance de se imaginar jogando algumas das campanhas malucas dele (não me julguem XD).

Ultimo tópico: Multiplayer
Eu cheguei na metade da campanha sozinho porque não podia jogar online por vários motivos e chegou num ponto que ficou extremamente chato seguir solo, apesar do seu fiel gato companheiro que, eu não sabia na época, que podia chamar outros gatos e/ou animais menores dos mapas para te ajudar nas caças e que os devs criaram um sistema bem interessante que aumenta a efetividade desses aliados temporários conforme você joga com eles, mas isso só funciona em missões sem outros jogadores.
A comunidade, pelo menos na minha experiência fazendo certos eventos pós-final de campanha tem sido muito positiva, com grupos formados por pessoas diferentes que nunca jogaram juntas mas que dialogam procurando objetivos em comum e mantendo o clima simples e sem muita besteira (tirando o pessoal que modifica certas falas automáticas do jogo por coisas toscas e infantis mas isso é, no geral, irrelevante).

Conteúdos adicionais ainda estão sendo lançados para a expansão Iceborne na data dessa review e elas são ÓTIMAS, sempre envolvendo novos monstros, novos eventos e missões diferentes além de um ou outro evento de colaboração com outras franquias como The Witcher e Assassins Creed (Horizon Zero Dawn foi exclusiva dos consoles mas agora com a vinda do jogo a Steam, quem sabe...).

E se no fim do dia tudo que você quer é ficar a toa mexendo em tranqueiras cosméticas, o jogo te permite fazer isso tanto na sua própria roupa quanto na sua arma (esse é recente então ainda um pouco limitado) e até em um quarto particular que você pode enfeitar como quiser e chamar seus amigos pra com certeza não babarem no seu senso épico de estilo, Feng Shui design de interiores e os pequenos animais que você tirou da vida dura na selva para embelezarem seu quarto e viverem livres e felizes.

Divirta-se ^.^>

72413050.review:
게임에 깊숙히 파고싶다면 정말 추천드립니다. 솔직히 장식주나 이런거 안나오면 엄청 스트레스이고 물욕 한번 터지면 나오지 않는 맘타로트 무기들은 분명 누구에게는 커다란 단점이겠지만 그래도 천천히 하나하나 맞춰가면서 원하는 장식주가 나올때, 원하는 무기가 나올때 그 짜릿함. 현금내면서 가챠하는 것보다 꾸준히 플레이하고 얻는 이런 가챠시스템은 저같은 경우는 찬성하고싶어요. 물론 안나오면 열받긴하지만 말이에요. 그 외에도 이번에 나온 알바트리온 같은 경우는 하루 꼬박 6시간동안 단 한번도 못깨고 스트레스를 엄청 받았지만 '몬헌'의 특성이 점점 몬스터의 패턴에 익숙해진다는 겁니다. 처음 도전할때는 3분컷 당하고 다음 도전할때는 5분컷 점점 시간이 늘어나면서 다른 무기도 써보고 다른 공략도 찾아보고 다시 도전해보고 그렇게 계속하니 장비도 새로맞춰보고 속성치도 높여보고 그리고 클리어했네요. 모든 몬스터가 이렇습니다. 유난히 쉬운 몬스터가 있는반면 갑작스럽게 지랄맞는 몬스터나오면 '제정신이냐 이걸 어떻게 깨라는거냐' 근데 포기않고 계속해보시면 클리어가 됩니다. 그리고 이상한건 이 게임은 한번 몬스터 잡아보면 무의식으로 자신감이 생기는지 난이도가 확내려가요. 그렇게 점점 고여가면서 몬헌의 매력에 빠지면 어떤 액션게임도 이만큼의 재미를 주진 못할겁니다.

그러니깐 사세요 저는 지금 새로나온 나비 치장품 사러갑니다.

72430945.review:
用一句話總結：
先想盡辦法做出守衛隊武器然後抱大腿農完一支超強冥赤龍武器其他垃圾龍的武器就都可以不用做了。

好吧現在小夫出現之後可能要把冥赤龍換成小夫了。

=====================以下正文=====================

我是一個從MH2開始入坑
前前後後玩過MHP2.MHP2G.MHFO.MHP3.MHFG.MHXX的玩家
MHW目前玩了700多小時
談談個人意見

優點：

1.首要的當然是模組細緻化
只要有接觸過以前的MH系列玩家應該都特別有感
畢竟就算拿2017年的MHXX switch ver.來跟2018年出的MHW相比
那畫質真的是相去甚遠
不論是人物裝備、怪物跟地圖的貼圖紋理
無一不被MHW慘虐

2.動作流暢度
這應該也是大家很有感觸
凡舉以往人物轉向或是動作之後的卡卡感
這代都有大幅度的改善
尤其是奔跑之後的轉向動作
比起以前更符合人體實際動作情況

3.新增許多新系統
最重要的當然就是環境生物啦
看那可愛的柔毛秧雞還有溫泉銀猴
不只可以抓還可以放在小屋內讓他到處跑跟他互動
現在甚至還出了外觀裝備可以頂在頭上
我豈不天天頂著到處跑？
還有像是IB新出的飛翔爪撞頭系統
或是地盤爭奪之類的
很多對狩獵有幫助以及符合真實情況的系統
都是以前的MH系列所沒有的

=====================前方高能=====================

缺點：

1.很慘的連線狀況
這不知道是該怪V社還是C社
相信有在連線狩獵的大家應該都很有感
有事沒事狩獵到一半隊友都不見了剩自己孤單狩獵的感覺
真的很慘 QQ

2.貼皮武器過多
以前的MH系列各種魔物的武器都有一些自己的特色
就算是最基本的藍跳跳或是大方哥我都覺得很有特色
但是MHW的武器常常看到基底武器的樣子明明就一樣
上面多了一點魔物的特色素材(EX：毛或鱗片)這樣就算另一種武器了？
讓人想收集武器的慾望都少了大半
雖然現在有武器外觀系統
但也只是把其他武器的外觀套上來而已

3.抽武器的系統
這也是我最不能接受的地方
「狩獵魔物後利用魔物的素材製作裝備再一步一步打上更高等的龍」
應該是這個遊戲的基本
然而自從絢輝龍出現到現在的冥赤龍
「抽武器」反而變成了這遊戲的重點
我能體會C社搞了一個大型合作狩獵的東西就是希望玩家多刷才不會造成沒人組隊的窘境
但是好不容易搞死一隻超大BOSS之後竟然還要抽武器？
武器種類隨機？屬性也隨機？然後不同屬性又是只有貼皮？

WTF？

還有就是冥赤龍那不可理喻的強化
自從冥赤龍武器出了之後這個遊戲都可以改名叫做冥赤龍世界了吧
你是要其他垃圾龍的武器情何以堪？
我其他什麼都不用做就做一把守衛隊然後主線解一解就跟團刷出冥赤龍一直強化上去
強化到滿之後再去虐其他種龍然後說我超強在座都是垃圾
這根本就是完美的遊戲體驗破壞者啊
這就是C社所期望新米獵人認識MH系列的方式嗎？
說真的我無法認同這種遊戲機制

=====================抱怨完畢=====================

總結下來我還是推
畢竟大部分方面來說MHW還是進步了很多
但就是絢輝龍跟冥赤龍的武器系統讓我無法釋懷
好了不說了我先繼續刷冥赤龍去...

73437813.review:
Oh boy, this game. Lemme tell ya, this game is awesome. It really is. 

I didn't really knew about this franchise at all, so it's my first game of the series, so can't compare it to anything. 

So, the game. Let's talk. I will cover the base game only, Iceborne will get another review from me soon.

[list]
[*] [b]Gameplay[/b] 
I'll start with the gameplay. It's an absolute fucking blast to play this game. I mean, like, REALLY. IT'S AWESOME. I've never felt this badass while smacking and smashing monsters 10+ times my size until I played this game. Why so? Well, the answer is... there is 14 types of weapons. Each one has a unique playstyle that can be really hard to master. You might be playing for 50 hours and think to yourself "man I'm sure is great with a long sword not gonna lie". The next moment: you watch some videos online about the long sword and realize that you were playing it wrong. All this time. Yeah, relatable. Once you really master the weapon, you will become the local Doom Guy or something, I dunno. It just feels so cool to finally master something in this game. That's why I like it so much. Potential is here. And game will always give you more stuff to do. More challenges. More tools to play with. More monsters to smack. More monsters to faint to also. I'm looking at you, Lunastra. 

So, if you wanna always improve and always find new ways to do stuff - get this game right now. Don't even bother reading the rest of the review.

[*] [b]Story[/b]
Story is pretty simple actually. You smack monsters so they don't do shit. I'm kidding. It's not THAT simple. But still, nothing groundbreaking or anything. One thing tho. The way story is presented makes you feel like a badass hunter. And that's cool. Especially if you are playing solo. Feels good man. 

[*] [b]Graphics[/b]
Visual quality of the game is great. I like it. My PC ain't that good tho, so I'm playing on medium settings. Still cool! Just take a look at the screenshots in the store page I guess? 

[*] [b]Optimization[/b] 
To be honest? Kinda sucks. I've read that developers ducked up some things while porting Iceborne, so... meh. I mean, it's playable for sure. Ain't bothering me that much. Still, could be much better, and I guess it was.

[*] [b]Online Play[/b]
You can play solo, you can play in a co-op. Simple, right? Right. It's really cool to play with someone, so please, give it a try. Convince your friend, gf, wife, whatever to play the game with you. Learn together! It's very fun. 
Playing solo is nice too. I guess I feel more badass this way? Maybe.

[*] [b]Music[/b] 
Words can't describe how beautiful some of the tracks are. Take for example theme of Vaal Hazak. It's ridiculously impressive. Music in Japanese games is always so cool.
[/list]

The game is actually fantastic and well worth your time. Just don't get scared by a long tutorial. Also try as much weapons as you can before actually going to a hunt. That's all. I recommend.

72907714.review:
巨大怪物的压迫感，酣畅淋漓的战斗快感，以小博大的成就感


一款注重过程的游戏
作为一个初次游玩怪物猎人游戏玩家的，不想去谈什么系列传承，核心玩法。仅仅谈一下个人对游戏的体验。有人说这是一款刷刷刷游戏，我不敢苟同。当你初次挑战大型怪物，结算发现几十分钟已过而你毫无感觉之时。当你在只有最后一猫，弹尽粮绝，怪物在你的绝望一击之下突然暴毙之时。当你被一只怪物蹂躏了N次，第一次发救援信号，天降三猛男之时。你还真的在意结算时候刷到的奖励吗？如果你只是功利的玩游戏，那么想必你的游戏过程是极其痛苦的，战斗时间长，素材/珠子爆率低。但是这个游戏的乐趣不在刷到什么东西，而在于在这个刷过程中让你熟悉手中的武器以及怪物的招式，体验爽快的动作以死相搏的快感。当你刷出一身毕业神装时游戏其实也已经结束了，回首望去乐趣其实全在这过程之中。最后再赞一下优秀的BGM，气氛烘托十分到位，让每场战斗都充满史诗感。


终极的狩猎体验
怪物猎人系列作为游戏机起家的作品初次登陆PC，除了能让更多的玩家接触到这款优秀的游戏外，更大的意义是带来了更好的游戏体验。更多的外设选择，PC更强的硬件将游戏体验升到了更高的层次，超高刷新率让游戏更流畅不错过每一帧动作，UltraWide 显示器带给你更广阔的视野、4K HD Texture Pack让怪物的每个鳞片都清晰可见、还有各种美化MOD等。经常有人问同样的游戏为什么要选择PC版？多样化自由的选择+强劲的硬件性能 = 终极的游戏体验。想必每个游戏开发者都希望自己的游戏能够有当下最好的体验，PC版的推出也算是圆了他们的梦想。




游玩建议
1.游戏属于慢热型，需要耐心，不适合快餐/竞技游戏玩家。
2.初次游戏请不要使用任何修改器显血插件商店MOD等。
3.游戏优化一般，如果配置较低帧数不稳定，锁定30帧是一个好选择。
4.没有购入冰原DLC的玩家不要使用守护者/防卫队的装备，会极大破坏开荒游戏体验。
5.主线任务请尽量单人通关，锻炼技巧增强游戏性。

73545775.review:
Llevo jugando Monster Hunter muchos años, desde mi vieja PSP, edición tras edición y he de decir que, aunque echo de menos algunas cosas de antiguas ediciones el juego no ha hecho más que crecer y evolucionar de buena manera en todo este tiempo implementando nuevas y sorprendentes mecánicas, con más y más contenido, eventos, etc.
Tiempo atrás habría sido impensable un MH de esta magnitud y creo que al menos hasta el momento, han conseguido estar a la altura.
Iceborne además incluye un sinfín de contenido adicional, además de muchos monstruos ya conocidos que vuelven a verse de nuevo.
Este juego tiene las horas que quieras echarle, ni más ni menos.
He de decir además, que jamás un MH a pesar de la cantidad tan abrumadora de contenido que tiene ha sido tan amigable con los nuevos jugadores, para aquellos que ya lo conocen no será un problema, y para aquellos nuevos aunque al principio pueda parecer confuso les será bastante fácil familiarizarse con las dinámicas del juego, cosa que antaño era una auténtica locura y era más complejo de aprender dado que no había tanta información, cosa que ahora además está dentro del propio juego.

¡Larga vida cazadores!

73516824.review:
[h1]Monster Hunter World, c’est donc ça le métier de chasseur ?[/h1]

Je comptais parler de Monster Hunter World et son extension en vidéo mais Dieu seul sait quand j’aurais la motivation et l’envie de le faire. Et donc après 500h sur le jeu original, et 200h sur son extension Iceborne. Me voici en chair et en écrit pour parler de Monster Hunter World.

[i]Cette évaluation ne portera que sur Monster Hunter World, si vous voulez mon avis sur Iceborne, il est [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/sacrezar/recommended/1118010/]ici[/url].[/i]

Le monde le résume à “Faut tuer des monstres pour avoir des armures stylées”... Monster Hunter World ! La série des monster hunter, ça a toujours été assez banal finalement. On est sur du farming de mobs à volonté et ce depuis le tout début. C’est l’essence même du jeu. Et ensuite autour se sont ajoutés tous les éléments qui ont rendu chacun des jeux plus ou moins uniques.

Monster Hunter World, sorti donc en août 2018 (outch ça faisait longtemps que je prévoyais cette vidéo…) est la suite tant attendu de la licence Monster Hunter où le but est simplement de chasser des monstres avec ou sans amis, avec ou sans inconnus. Oui très clairement comme dans tout jeu de la licence, Monster Hunter World met l’accent sur la coopération. Cependant bien que le jeu perde une de ses saveurs en solo, il est tout à fait faisable et amusant seul. 

Dans Monster Hunter World, les joueurs rencontreront des monstres qu’ils ont déjà vus dans les épisodes précédents mais aussi des nouveaux dangers. Le jeu a été rendu plus accessible, il est donc tout à fait possible de trouver contentement même si l’on souhaite y jouer de temps à autre. Cependant, une fois en endgame, préparez vous à farm. Grind encore et encore pour votre vie et surtout pour se challenger sur des monstres “Tempered” et “Arch Tempered” qui sont des versions un peu plus vénères des monstres du même nom. 

Alors oui, c’est certain, dès le début du jeu, on se rend bien compte que Monster Hunter World ne brille pas par son histoire quand bien même le rendu des cinématiques puisse être aussi beau, l’histoire de la trame principale est aussi pertinente que le décalage voix-bouche des personnages que ce soit en VO ou dans n’importe quelle langue. 

Le narratif de Monster Hunter World est, à mon avis, au ras des pâquerettes qualitativement parlant cependant la trame vous prendra bien une cinquantaine d’heures si vous chillez. Et si vous accrochez vraiment, vous passerez peut être 500h comme moi. Ou même 2000h comme les plus aguerris. 

Le portage PC de Monster Hunter World a eu quelques débuts catastrophiques, il faut bien l’avouer. Cependant, aujourd’hui c’est plutôt une réussite. On regrettera seulement les points suivants :
[list]
[*]L’absence de Cross Platform;
[*]Le fait de ne pas pouvoir rejoindre les expéditions (sans SOS Flare) des personnes de la même session;
[*]Le fait de ne pas pouvoir rejoindre les quêtes des gens s’ils n’ont pas vu la cinématique.
[/list]
Le point majeur étant l’absence de Cross Platform, il faut avouer que ç’aurait été bien de pouvoir jouer avec nos amis les consoleux. Quant aux deux points suivants, ils sont gênants tout au plus mais pas de quoi faire fleurir des roses.

Maintenant, il faut l’avouer que ce soit au niveau interaction avec l’environnement côté monstre ou côté joueur, on est quand même servi. Il y a vraiment moyen d’exploiter le jeu de diverses manières et c’est ça qui le rend d’autant plus intéressant. Les 14 types d’armes auxquels on a accès renforcent d’ailleurs la diversité du gameplay et à ce jour je crois d’ailleurs qu’il y a des armes que je n’ai encore jamais ou très peu jouées. 

Je recommande Monster Hunter World, c’est un jeu sur lequel j’ai passé beaucoup de temps, tant pour me défouler que pour jouer avec des amis. J’adhère totalement à l’aspect Coopération qui prône face à l’aspect Compétition tout en gardant cependant place pour les speedrunners.

[quote]Vous pouvez suivre la page curateur ici : [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28282773/]Sacrez'Art[/url].[/quote]

72646396.review:
有名シリーズである大型モンスターの狩りが中心になるゲームと言う事で、
ハマる人と投げ出す人の二種類に分かれるゲームだと思います。
プレイ時間の通り、私はハマった方です。

【良い点】
・キーボードマウス操作がかなり楽（設定項目がそれなりにあるので、好みの配置にしやすい）
・防具、スキル等、各プレイヤーごとにあった戦い方の選択肢が多い（ソロ限定かもですが）
・単純に大型モンスターを倒し、装備を整える以外にもやりこみ要素がある（Steam実績以外にもあります）
・PSP世代の過去作しかプレイしてない人間からすると、難易度が下がってるので気楽に挑める
・定期的に追加される新モンスター（要アイスボーン）

【悪い点】
・ゲームの進行、プレイ上致命的ではないが、細かいバグが目に付く（ポーチのアイテム順が崩れる、クエスト中の状態異常表記が残ったままになる、チャットの入力や切り替えができなくなる、など）
・チャット欄で一度に入力できる文字数が少ないため、チャットを介しての意思疎通が慣れるまでちょっと面倒
・ゲーム以外のソフト（ブラウザ、Steamチャットなど）を起動すると多発する通信エラー
・武器のデザインはもうちょいバリエーション付けるとか何とかならんのか（双剣使いの愚痴）

とまあ色々書きましたが、
何回も繰り返して同じモンスターを倒し、自分のプレイヤースキルが上達することに喜びを感じる人は楽しく感じるゲームだと思います。
購入からもう少しで1年になりますが、私はまだまだ道半ばといったところです。

ああ、あとスタンプ1個でもいいですし、定型文からの選択でもいいです。
マルチでやるときは他プレイヤーとコミュニケーション取ってみてください。
それだけでソロと違うマルチの楽しみにハマることができると思います。
逆に、終始無言だとせっかく集会所に集まっても他の人と組めずにぼっち辛すぎとかになります。

73312328.review:
[h1]怪物猎人世界是一款怎样的游戏？[/h1]
久闻怪猎大名，夏促终于入坑，此前从未接触过前作。
在下决心购买这款300+的游戏之前，我看了许多视频，也咨询了一些玩家。最后我得出的结论是：这款游戏有着扎实的动作系统，出色的生态设定，炫酷的各种古龙，以及基数众多的玩家群体。[b]好，买了。[/b]
初入游戏，怪猎的世界充满了新鲜感。古代树森林，猎人初次踏进的世界，在其中收集素材，跟踪痕迹，时而面对乱入的蛮鄂龙和火龙，刺激；大蚁冢荒地，在其中收集素材，跟踪痕迹，目睹泥鱼龙和土砂龙特别的交战动画，感叹生态之奇妙；陆珊瑚台地，在其中收集素材，跟踪痕迹，看战地记者把风飘龙闪下天，不禁感到一丝滑稽；瘴气之谷，在其中收集素材，跟踪痕迹——
玩到上位之后，我意识到怪猎主线的推动形式极为单一，无外乎收集素材，跟踪痕迹，然后播一个动画——你和你的aibo站在一起，怪冲了出来，你救了aibo，你面对怪，开打。此外，看似生机勃勃的世界其实有着一丝呆板：怪物出生位置和可采集资源位置基本固定，意味着每次探索的世界基本相同。想把怪猎的“世界”玩出新奇感，也仅限于前几次了。作为伪开放世界，这个不大的地图的一草一木都为战斗所服务，纵使怪物之间、怪物和环境有精彩的互动，也不能改变环境本身的欠缺。这一缺陷全靠出色的战斗弥补。打完本体，体会到优秀的BGM配上卡普空的打击感，我确信这是一款优秀的动作游戏，剧情么，图一乐。随后的冰原，虽然听闻制作人“想要突出描写具体角色的特点”，但实际打下来，我好像也没对无论是aibo还是原野大师抑或是官二代产生具体的感情，满脑子都是“[spoiler]这个怪怎么这么喜欢跳啊/这个怪怎么这么喜欢飞啊/我怎么又猫了啊[/spoiler]”,最后弟弟龙的登场冲击力十足，却也只是以“大自然真奇妙啊”草草收尾。最近更新的煌黑龙加了一些耐人寻味的对话，让我感觉capcom还是有想讲些什么故事的欲望，只不过它可能做不好，玩家也懒得看。
[b]那么怪猎是优秀的RPG游戏吗？[/b]怪猎的RPG元素显得有些奇怪。武器、防具以素材逐步升级，衣装、护石的解锁，珠子、客制强化，下位、上位直到M位，如此大的升级空间，到最后还是用着一样的招式，加了不到3倍的伤害，挑战10倍于先前血量的怪。经常被调侃说难的黑魂，也可以一直升级练成水桶号，而怪猎人物性能的上限，决定了这款游戏的精髓之处只能在于动作。熟悉怪的动作，熟悉武器的动作，在合适的时机打出最大收益，没有花里胡哨的加点星座魔法和等级加成，只有战斗的经验。
[b]这种要素很特殊。[/b]它要求时间。有动作游戏基础的人不难看出一发蓄力横扫的时机，却很难知道这发横扫后面会不会接一发甩尾，甩尾怎么防御才能打出一个小硬直。这种学习成本贯穿了游戏的前中后期，也导致了玩家群体的分层，1k小时以上的大佬比比皆是，玩不转退款/弃坑的也不少。然而，我并没有否认装备的重要性。上述系统所组合出的配装，正是为动作的容错率和打法上提供了空间。不过我只是玩了百来小时的萌新，对于进一步的战斗要素也就不进一步妄加评论了（一百小时，新手村都没入，怪猎，恐怖如斯！）。
上面讲的要素，对热爱钻研的玩家来说是不折不扣的优点，那种从被怪压起身到把怪压起身的成就感是无可比拟的，这是屏幕前的玩家的水平提升。至少我这100多个小时里没有垃圾时间，全程沉迷于与怪物的战斗。游戏难度真的不算很高，稍作准备大多数怪都可以初见过，实在不行还有逃课打法和救难信号。怪物招式丰富有趣又有一定规律，能得以一窥设计风味，可谓是把boss战做到了极致。[b]好玩，爽。[/b]
不过我还是想斗胆说说我的一些偏见。[spoiler]除了前面提到过的剧情等于没有，地图就那么几套花样这些对ACT/ARPG游戏影响不大的要素，这动作，尤其是这nmd猎人，小动作多的一p，什么收刀耍花枪，被吼住在原地瞎jb望，地震都过了这么久还在爬，眩晕还得站起来挨打，喝药先看一下，大毅力竖大拇指，组队能被队友打硬直，被怪碰了几下还nm胆怯，大哥，你是猎人啊，你胆怯个锤子！被恶心到了？没关系，我们有技能！只要你舍弃你那些会心攻击，来多插几个耳塞耐冲耐绝，你就能体验正常动作游戏的流畅感！你看，多真实，多还原现实。还有多半差评热卖中的冰原，被骂的很惨，最大原因就是口水硬，一个大后退，你还等你这招空大硬直结束，收刀，跑过去，再钩头上手。很多人可能觉得“好啊，都给你简化成这样了还要喷，我们老猎人以前喝药还得摆劲霸男装呢！”那我只能说：我不配玩。[/spoiler]
最后客观（主观？）地来总结下。满分均为10分
剧情：4分 什么，这游戏有剧情？
画面：8分 Capcom老引擎虽不如Re，但基本还是能令人满意
动作：9分 动作天尊Capcom，虽然因为RPG要素有所取舍不过瑕不掩瑜
玩法：6分 打boss。变着法打。到处打。挖材料。不够就打boss。变着法打。
肝度：10分 愿意肝真的可以玩很久！说的就是你，聚魔之地。
难度：6分 后期别忘了针对怪物弱点进行配装，别穿了防卫队就脱不下来了
联机：8分 大部分时间得开加速器，不过和小伙伴一起猫车也很欢乐。记得耐冲。

72881269.review:
I think this game has been the first in a while that made me played it so much.

I have seen many posts and reviews about performances issues; I do not have the most recent rig (i7 4790K and a 2070 SUPER), on a 1440P screens, and have no issues whatsoever. Just wanted to clarify.

I have rarely seen a developper being so dedicated and putting so much effort and love in an AAA franchise like this one.
Yes, there is an extention but it seems to be how they proceed with every iteration of the game, but the fact is that they are adding so much into the game for free, with cosmetics being quite cheap is just awesome.

Bringing back old monsters must be so nice for vets, but as a new comer, it also great to see what have been done on the previous games. The environments are all different and well designed, the music is super good, ton of fun with your friends, tons of challenges solo.

Hell, I even bought GU on the Switch because MH and MHI are so good.

You love challenge, fun, dedication from the devs, constant updates ? Man this game is for you.

73800569.review:
[u] Zoru Başardığınızda Gelen O Tatmin Olma Hissini Sevenlere  [/u]

[u]  "Her şeyden önce, eğer türe ilk defa girecekseniz, psikolojinizi hazırlayın"  [/u]

İlk olarak, oyun türünü ele alalım, böylece sizi nelerin beklediğini yavaştan anlayabilirsiniz. Monster Hunter World, hack'n slash bir mmo oyunudur, isterseniz tek başına, isterseniz de 4 kişilik gruplar halinde oynayabilirsiniz.

MHW' derin bir hikayeye sahip olsa da oyun bunu sizlere açık bir şekilde sunmuyor. Eğer lore'u merak ediyorsanız, ve daha önce hiç MHW dünyasına giriş yapmamışsanız farklı kaynaklardan lore hakkında bilgi edinmeniz gerekebilir.

Oyunda temel amacınız, avladığınız devasa canavarlardan düşen ganimetlerle daha iyi silahlar, zırhlar ve ekipmanlar elde ederek en iyi avcı konumuna gelmek.

[b] 'Siz geliştikçe karşınıza çıkan canavarların, nasıl güçlendiğini fark edeceksiniz" [/b]

MHW' nin başarılı olduğu bir diğer konu ise karakter gelişimi. Karakteriniz ile çıktığınız bu yolculukta adım adım onun nasıl geliştiğini oyun sizlere çok iyi yansıtıyor.

Monster Hunter World sadece canavar avlamaktan ibaret değil, eğer avlanmaya ara vermek isterseniz oyunda bulunan  "expedition" modu ile ister gidip, çeşit çeşit bitkileri toplayabilir, bölgelerin coğrafi özelliklerini keşfedebilir, isterseniz balık tutmak gibi çeşitli aktivitelere kendinizi kaptırabilirsiniz.

Tabi, ben en çok SOS fişeği atan zor durumdaki başka oyuncuları kurtarmaktan zevk alıyorum.

 [h1] Oyunun Bel Kemiği Combat Sistemi [/h1]

MHW'ye ilk girdiğinizde kısa sürede oyunda çeşit çeşit silah olduğunu görecekseniz. Baltalar, kısa kılıçlar, büyük kılıçlara, menzilli silahlardan, arbaletlere ve daha fazlasına erişiminiz olacak.

Tam burada oyunda herhangi bir skill yada level sistemi olmadığını belirtmem gerek. Önemli olan etken oyuncunun seçtiği silahı ne denli kullanabildiği, yani bileğinize güvenip saatlerce seçtiğiniz silahta yada silahlarda ustalaşmanız gerek. MHW'de silahları öğrenmekte ustalaşmakta zordur, zaman ister.

[h1] Peki Oyunun Performans Durumu Nasıl [/h1]

Şimdi öncelikle, oyunun konsol sürümünü 150, Pc sürümünü de 240 saat oynamış birisi olarak, kendim hiç 60fps altına düşmedim. 

Oyun ilk çıktığı dönemlerde, bazı oyunculara sorun yaşatsa da sonrasında gelen güncellemeler ile hataları , eksikleri toparladılar. Yine de ben Orta-İyi seviyelerinde bir sisteminiz yok ise oyunu önermiyorum. Stabil fps MHW gibi combat'ın bel kemiği olduğu bir oyunda çok önemli. 

[h1] Ortalama Oyun Süresi [/h1]

Giriş seviyesi oyuncular için 50-70 saat, 
Türü Sevenlere, yada sevebilecek olanlara 100+ saat ,
Ben gibi, psikopat kişilere ise çok daha uzun saatler vaat eden bir yapımdır MHW

[h1] Toparlayacak Olursak [/h1]

Monster Hunter World, türe başlamak yada Monster Hunter evrenine girmek isteyen herkes için çok ideal bir yapım. Benim açımdan tek eksisi yeni oyunculara biraz zorluk yaratabilir, ama şunu belirtmem gerek oyunun topluluk tarafı çok sıcak kanlı. Deneyimli avcılar sürekli yeni avcılara yol gösteriyor, bundan oldukça keyif alıyorlar. 

Eğer sizlerde o devasa yaratıkları, zorlu boss savaşlarını seviyorsanız kesinlikle indirim döneminde Monster Hunter World' a bir şans vermeniz gerektiğini düşünmekteyim.

[h1] Her Şey İyi Güzel, Peki Ya Fiyat? [/h1]

Şimdi dostlar, kabul etmek gerek ki, MHW pahalı bir yapım.

Ana oyunun fiyatı %34 indirim ile 92 TL

Tek başına bir ana oyun kadar başarılı olan ek paketin, Iceborne 'u almak da isterseniz %25 indirim ile toplam da ikisi 203TL  'ye gelmekte.

Bahsettiğim gibi, eğer okuduklarınız ilginizi çektiyse fiyatını sonuna kadar hak eden bir yapımdır Monster Hunter World.

Tüm avcılara, iyi avlar...

Sinceramente pienso que es una gran recomendación para los amantes del Action RPG y quienes toleran o disfrutan del grindeo, en especial de esta gran saga de videojuegos que en lo personal considero que lo siguien haciendo de una forma adictiva, atrapante y emocionante sin importar cuántas horas le hayas invertido. 

Este juego claramente cuenta con sus desperfectos, pudiendo mencionar como ejemplo la cuestionable implementación de la garra, pero claro está que no existe tal cosa de "juego perfecto". No obstante, una vez que te adentras y exploras las posibilidades que el juego te ofrece al igual que su gran y amplio contenido (que es gratuito) te olvidas de esos detalles, sin contar además que la experiencia juego puede ser llevada en singler player aunque por supuesto lo más recomendable es compartirlo con amigos (ya que está pensado en ello). 

En definitiva, sin más que agregar puedo decir que es uno de los mejores juegos creados por la compañía nipona (Capcom), al igual que un gran Action RPG a tener muy en cuenta, les aseguro que desde mi experiencia personal es un juego el cual te recompensará cada centavo invertido en él.

72856259.review:
What a game!

Monster Hunter throws player into the world of huge monsters and even bigger weapons. As a power house of man you smack monsters in the face with a giant hammer, you hop around like annoying fly using insect glaive, shoot them with a gun bigger than GAU-8 Avenger, or you just became an indestructible mountain and make a kebab using your lance and shield.

And all this feels so satisfying, because every successful hunt is well deserved. You want to slap monsters like Jerry slaps Tom, then you have to work for it. Every new monster is a challenge, tough, but fair. But after few tries, you'll became stronger. You'll study monsters moves and use them to your advantage. You'll utilize a new move of your weapon understanding it little bit more. And after hundreds of hours of fun, you'll be that power house who just wipes floor with most of the monsters.

Behind that, there is another game. Game of tactics, careful preparation, studying weakness of each monster. Building gear with skills that suit your play style to max out your potential against that feared elder dragon looking at you across the mountain.

Monster Hunter has been my favorite game series for many years and Monster Hunter: World only reassured me in that view. I can only recommend this game, and I always will. It can be overwhelming in the beginning, but it's worth it! Poogie for life!

As many have said before, the progression is GREAT! You constantly get better and learn more. The skill ceiling for some weapons is really high, but achievable! The weapons and armor look great, the grapchics are really nice, and I like the music and sounds as well!
I will definitly get Icewborne as well, just to get more of this game.

10 Nergigantes out of 10 Deviljhos!

73880496.review:
MHW was my first experience with a Monster Hunter game, and I absolutely loved it. I mean, you can smash a fire-breathing t-rex in the head with a hammer, while wearing armor made out of his friends - what's not to like? There's a lot to wrap your head around when it comes to strategy and customization, but once you do, it's hard to put it down. This was the perfect game to sink into over the COVID quarantine.

Multiplayer is great, and other players are, more often than not, helpful and friendly. I'd suggest getting into group hunts as early as you can, as it makes the grind for materials way more bearable. 

My biggest gripe with the game is the end, after you've completed the main story line. To improve your gear to take on some of the most exciting monsters in the game, you need to grind Elder Dragons on the hardest difficulty to get specific streamstones (nothing in the game actually tells you this), which usually allows you 1 to 2 faints. A tempered Elder Dragon can one-shot you. After multiple solo and group hunts trying to grind out these stupid streamstones for weapons and armor, i just got frustrated and gave up. I put the game down and haven't been back since. 

That being said, I had a great time with 90% of the game. The fun I had with the core game definitely has me debating on grabbing Iceborne in the near future.

73848828.review: 众所周知太刀登龙的伤害都靠刀尖挥出的剑气打得 剑气打那伤害在哪 刀砍中了头但是剑气没有砍中，那么没有伤害很正常 登龙三跳打头四打跳胸是因为怪物原地高速抖动产生空间扭曲改变了剑气判定位置。从十层楼高度跳下屁事没有的苍蓝星面对只被怪物震动了一次的地面，却只能在地面上爪巴不起，这是因为怪物朝地面敲击的同时利用滑铲拳让地面触电，让玩家们看起来是在爬，其实是麻了 毕竟怪物和人的体质不是能一概而论的。飞在半空中被怪物地面攻击击落，是应为怪物都是气功带师，用幽波纹对玩家发动了一般人看不见的替身攻击 。由此可见和这种怪物对战的就算是晕到还不忘爬起来吸引火力的苍蓝星们是多么强大，生态环境设计简直完美，每次都能在意想不到的地方遇到普通的力战王台阶。怪物之间的互动十分灵性，路过见面直接相互问候家属山歌对唱，有时唱上一曲还不尽兴还要再唱上几句 属实睦邻和谐又友好。在游戏内甚至可以用屎块投喂怪物，怪物吃饱过后会大喊一声谢谢然后转区，但是有时一次是喂不饱的，之后怪物还有可能会回来找你希望你能再次投食 怪物们自产自销简直节能环保。钩爪简直这部作品的精华所在，钩头上手肯定是我自己钩歪了 勾上去点击向左跳人物却像右跳一定是我自己按错键了。玩怪物猎人这么长时间了， 不知不觉已经更新了三次键盘两次鼠标一次显示屏 极大加快了我家电脑的新陈代谢。能将游戏制作到这种程度的人想必已经超越了人类的极限成为了非人的存在 十分感谢卡普空公司和♥TGY♥先生为玩家们带来怪猎世界冰原这样的完美的游戏！

73836433.review:
先吹彩虹屁吧。你看看这一个两个人均500+h的时长就知道，如果你喜欢ATC，喜欢一点点磨练手法的快乐，[b]买就对了！[/b]

森林里的暴徒有毛茸茸的尾巴，天空之主一家有四角爱恨情仇，沙地之王是个一害羞就钻地的胆小鬼，食物链顶端的是一根多刺的黄瓜。
老古龙看起来脾气暴躁其实在背上藏了不少好东西给你，那只红色的狮子真的打不过它老婆，那条亮闪闪的飞龙有偏头痛，还有双马尾的大刺猬，日常最喜欢就是梳毛然后嘤嘤叫。最后那所谓古龙之王啊，其实是个刚出生blingbling的小baby，六只卡姿兰大眼睛惹人怜爱。
在冰原里的话，有暴躁太刀老哥，暴躁蝙蝠老哥，暴躁boomboom老哥，可能是天冷大家辣子吃多了。鸟龙种出了个全村希望，优雅又充满良心，安静且胆小；新的牙兽是个上了年纪的老猴子，行动迟缓慈祥和蔼；最新的煌黑大哥超nice的，就算是新人也可以打掉他的角。

行了不bb了，还是说点正经的。

本体玩了800+h开始进入倦怠期，不久后进入冰原又肝了300+h，实在刷不动了。本体龙脉石掉落的选择性是主要的劝退点，[b]玩儿什么不掉什么你是想干嘛啊？？？[/b]
相比之下绚辉龙刷武器都是小意思了。冰原的怪相比本体太过好动，武器属性值被强调而怪的属性吸收被大幅调低，就很莫名其妙。飞爪我觉得不是什么痛点，反而觉得挺好使的[spoiler]可能是因为我是半个斩斧main吧[/spoiler]
因为新加的怪不算多，所以300+基本上也没有什么新鲜感了。一般到这种时候就开始琢磨竞速了吧？但是问题来了，[b]这个蛋疼的聚魔之地。[/b]
以前我龙脉石不够，刷调查就行了，愿意打谁都可以，反正结算里会有的；可是聚魔之地那尼玛……普通的历战的素材都不一样需求还爆多，没出引导的炼金术之前全靠随机等怪，偶尔想客新武器了，一看哦吼要调低等级刷普通。策划你的良心不会痛吗？！！
而且聚魔之地完全就是婉拒弓箭，要专门腾一个4级孔放地学你知道弓箭main的痛吗？？
现在想尝试新路子根本没动力，一想到要肝一万件克制素材我就吐了……引导的炼金术来得太晚[strike]我的心已经死[/strike]了
等我过了这段贤者时间应该还是会重新玩起来，毕竟我还能记得，初来新大陆那个无尽的夏天。

73731205.review:
Compared to other games of the genre, see PSO, God Eater and Dauntless, Monster hunter once again managed to do everything better, Balanced fights, except probably Velkhanna, but she is a totally new monster so I can give them a pass on this, And Amazing sense of gear progression and very good fight design overall.
 
Even though It would probably be unfair to compare it to PSO the father of the genre, PSO has evovled to become more like a 3rd person Diablo, while Monster hunter stayed true to it's roots.

Monster Hunter World: Iceborne is the latest instalment of a 15 year old franchise which manages to amaze me everytime and the nostalgia still holds up.


A long time player of MHFU I came back with my expectations not insanely high, but boy was I surprised. Capcom once again outdid themselves and the studio working behind the game after so many years, still puts a lot of passion on every single fight, except Vellkhanna, fuck you Vellkhanna.

::WEAPON BALANCE::
Game is exactly what you expect of a Monster Hunter game of previous generations but on steroids
Every weapon feels totally different but the current balance is pretty weird, at the time of this review, Heavy Bowgun, Bow and Greatsword are by far the best weapons to use on high-tier endgame, low maintenance easy combos, insane consistent damage and beeing multiplayer viable, with Longsword, Insect Glaive and Lance beeing dead last on the dps race, with 2 out of 3 requiring extremely high maintenance, having to have the damage buffs up 24/7 to be able to even catch up to Bow damage, Longsowrd lacking any kind of KO mechanics or flinch and in the same time having the biggest hitbox that will annoy the shit out of your teamates. 

At the end of the day, there is a META but everything is viable but not OPTIMAL, don't be weirded out if people ask you to change weapon, this is expected in Safi'Jiva and Kulve Taroth endgame bosses.

::SKETCHY THINGS ABOUT THE GAME::
The only real "sketchy" thing are the unskippable cutscenes, and probably the decoration grind which has been addressed with melder Gacha recently, but there are mods that change the shop so you are able to buy them with Zenny.( I don't encourage the usage of mods, but if you have very limited time in your day, the decoration farm will be a nightmare for you and you will not enjoy the game since most builds don't work without them)

Oh man, I have many things to say about Monster Hunter but will make it short for the reader.

BUY IT. 

At first, it may feel challenging and nearly impossible to get through base game or even Iceborne, but after getting a feel for how the mechanics work and develop what kind play style you have to defeat the monsters it gets insanely fun. The versatility for what kind of builds you can do is vast. There are just so many things you can do in this game and so many ways to do it. It is a very fun game especially if you play with a bunch of friends. 

The only downside is I am a lance player who got through base game, got through Iceborne, and did the final quest for rank MR 200 to get the gold plate name, yet I don't have the guard up decoration from base game. I have been grinding and grinding for it, yet I still don't even have one. If you can live with not being able to get every single rare decoration right away, then I highly recommend purchasing this game. 

Oh and you will disconnect a lot if you are playing with friends in a lobby, but the guard up decoration bothers me more.

73506672.review: This game is incredibly flawed, you often dodge a monster only to get crippled by a gust of wind or the monster's fart for all I know. The story is less than great and the dialogue (especially in the unskippable session-long intro) will make you want to carve your ears out. But all that said it can be incredibly satisfying, MH feels so much better on a keyboard and mouse that it can't be put into words, and the focus on fighting monsters as opposed to the hours of prep work in previous games has made this game far greater than any of the others in my opinion. 73168574.review:
My frustration:
I felt as though monsters mainly 'but not restricted to' the DLC had attacks that came without warning; meaning there was very little in the way of movements, patterns or animations that hinted a start to these attacks. This frustratingly increased the difficulty by making the game for me more focused around your raw reaction time rather than having learned specific movements of the monsters that would essentially give you a few seconds of warning. Personally I think these types of sudden attacks were a lot more common in the DLC and could force me to play very reserved (backed away or not locking myself into attack animations) or only engaging a certain part of the body to help avoid these attacks. However, its worth noting that this wasn't the case for all monsters and perhaps I simply couldn't decipher monsters movements well enough with only 200+ hours game play. 

Tips and playthrough:
I did for the most part play solo as I was continuously disconnected from servers, this was a recurring theme at the time. I used dual blades and a critical build throughout the entire game. I did good damage and had decent maneuverability with this setup, which was very enjoyable. However, I reckon other weapons were probably more satisfying given some for example could actually knock out monsters. I did really struggle at parts, but upon review I was 100% definitely under-geared during those times and should have used the environment traps to aid me. End game to me looked to be farming for; gear sets, decorations, pets and achievements, something I think you need to have a friend or group of frequent players to enjoy at its fullest. If you are playing for the solo experience and have little interest in end game I would recommend you NOT start with the 'defender armor' as it essentially allows you to steam roll through roughly a 3rd of the game and once you hit higher content you may feel a crushing increase in difficulty. I would only recommend using this armor on a second play through in order to sling shot yourself to high rank. My last tip would be to not sell any armor sets you really like as you can put it on display once you have the DLC player owned house.

Summary:
Its a beautiful game, one of the best I have ever played. Now that I have finished the story I can see myself playing this every so often. It isn't every game that I put 200+ hours into. There isn't much else to say, you hunt monsters in instanced areas.

73111114.review:
My first Monster Hunter game.
[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b]
- [b]Maximum Game Crack:[/b]  has the perfect dopamine release formula.  Achievements make you feel like you've accomplished something and are well paced.  When you kill a new monster, it doesn't just feel like a kindergarten-smiley-face sticker for good-effort.
- [b]Visuals:[/b] Remember to turn on the High Res Texture Pack through the in-game options.  Downloading it is not enough.  Visuals are stunning.  It is easy to get lost looking at the scenery.
- [b]Cosmetics:[/b] I thought fashion and dressing up dolls were just for little girls.  Never thought my outdated gender views would get such a slap in the face.  The variety in combinations of armor/weapons are endless.  You can make your toon look truly badass and, as I mentioned in my first point, it feels like you are earning your keep.
- [b]YOU are leveling, not your toon:[/b]  This is really the clincher for me - I really want to drive home the feeling of earning something.  This is similar in spirit to Dark Souls and Sekiro - After the story quests, it is not just about getting a higher Hunter Rank (in-game toon level) and that some how makes you stronger and the monsters weaker relatively.  You TRULY need to learn the monster behaviors.  The Monsters have their own personality and tactics and what worked on one may not work on the other.  The game engine allows for really dynamic monster behavior.  I've heard endgame-geared HR 999s saying they are still learning how to fight.
- Not just fighting monsters:  So yes, in Monster Hunter World, you will be in a [i]world[/i] where you will mostly be [i]hunting monsters[/i].  But what you do outside of the fight is just as important.  Crafting, cultivating, trading, eating, etc.  I love the crafting tree and I love the mix of ailments, elemental damages, monster strengths and weaknesses.  There is a research center where you log all your encounters and through hunting and tracking you unlock insights into monsters that help you in fighting or capturing monsters.  This is so COOL.  It isn't just brain-dead button mashing.  Knowing your enemy really does pay off.

[b][u]Cons:[/u][/b]
- Too much emphasis on long-term Monster Timings:  Let me explain...
You don't want the monsters to be easy.  You want them to be difficult because then it feels like you've accomplished something, however, there are many options on [i]how[/i] you make the monsters difficult.  In my experience, the majority of later monsters are difficult because of insane crowd-control - If you don't time a dodge correctly, you will be chain-crowd-controlled for a minute while getting 100-0.  This is completely a valid way of increasing difficulty of monsters and I'm fine with some monsters playing like this.  However, there is nothing more frustrating than sitting their for a minute watching your toon face inevitable doom.  I literally just sit back sometimes and go get something to eat because I know I won't be getting up for a while.  For me, I would much rather get outmatched by monster speed and dynamic movements rather than a lack of dynamics and abundance of crowd-control.  That is just me.  If you don't mind that, then disregard this con.
- Can I really not run and sheath my bow?:  Seriously, I've actually gone to a archery range and tried this and I TOTALLY can run and sheath my bow to a back-strap or simply sprint while holding a bow.  Again, you need to make the game difficult to make the achievements meaningful, however, don't choose weird, unrealistic game mechanics just to make it difficult if your goal is to make the game immersive.  Yes, if you have a great sword, you can't run and put that thing away.  In fact, I don't even know how you would hold a great sword like that, but I should be able to run with a bow #Legolas.
- I wish there was a player-trading system:  This would take this game to a new level that may be beyond the spirit of MH but it just seems natural to me.
- Controls customization:  I play with keyboard+mouse.  Many have recommended a controller.  I tried it and don't like it.  Either way you go, the in-game keybindings are pretty limited.  For example, you are limited to single-keys (you can't assign, say, CTRL+1).  On top of that, many of the characters on the keyboard that are normally available in other games are not available on here.  This isn't a huge issue because I found ways around it (luckily my keyboard+mouse can be customized outside of the game), but it is just annoying since I don't know the reason for this limitation.
- CONSTANTLY DISCONNECTING:  This is my biggest gripe and probably the only valid one.  It seems like MHW has it's own network and then Steam network is wrapped around it.  Whatever the arrangement is, searching for online sessions yields inconsistent results depending on if you are logged in to the steam friend list.  I've gotten booted in the middle of a fight and unable to rejoin friend sessions and forced to fight alone.  Do I right-click on the friend-list to join a friend?  Do I search for an online session?  I have to make my own online session before I can see my friends online session and then join theirs.  For a multiplayer game, the facilitation of multiple players is not optimized at all.

With the connection issues being really the only objective gripe and the other gripes being my personal preference, the PROS definitely outweigh the CONS.  This is just an amazing game and I'll be playing it for a very long time.

72769721.review:
Monster Hunter World is one of the few co-op PvE games I have ever played that has rarely become monotonous or boring. I have 800 hours playtime on PS4 and nearly 500 on PC, and I can safely say that this is the best entry in the series thus far. The combat is equally challenging as it is rewarding, and the 14 weapon types provide exceptional variety in play style. The perk-like skills players can acquire by combining armour pieces from over 100 armour sets enables seemingly endless theory-crafting and variety. There are also hundreds of mods available for the game (from NexusMods) which range from re-skins of armour and weapons to QoL improvements. 

The Iceborne expansion is everything I could hope for from an expansion, as it nearly doubles the number of monsters species or variants in the game. There have been 4 free title updates since iceborne's release which all offer at least one new monster species or variant of an existing monster. The only micro-transactions are all cosmetic and are incredibly inexpensive. There are currently 2 raid-like hunts in the game, which pit players against colossal monsters in which 16 hunters work towards the goal of downing the same monster in teams of 4 for pinnacle rewards. 

The only grievance I can mention is the sub-par experience when attempting to play with friends. Players are required to be in the same game session as their friends to play together. This process is often clunky. This combined with a bug which causes players to lose connection if they ALT+ESC out of the game (even briefly) has deterred 2 of my friends from playing MHW for longer than an hour at a time. That being said, the workaround for the bug is to play in borderless windowed mode. I hope that Capcom releases a future patch which enables one player to post a quest and have their friends automatically join the same quest (this process is currently manual). 

In conclusion, this game is fucking dope and it deserves all the praise it gets.

72706724.review:
La llegada de Alatreon ha movido bastante a la comunidad. Han saltado ya los ardidos que encuentran que el monstruo es demasiado difícil como para ser considerado un reto de verdad. Sin embargo, ese demasiado difícil en realidad no lo es tanto. Claro, hace bastante daño, pero es lo que se espera al nivel en que se está jugando. Sus patrones de combate si bien, tienen bastante alcance y son devastadores, son perfectamente legibles para alguien que sí presta atención a lo que hace. el DPS check de daño elemental es lo que más controversia genera, ya que por cada 5 mins que pasa, lanza su ataque imbloqueable Escaton's Judgement. Pero teniendo un buen daño elemental, es cosa de hacerle daño al dragón. Romperle los cuernos antes era un imposible, a menos que se jugara como gunner, ya que nunca bajaba la cabeza, y podía pasar la mitad del tiempo en el aire, because. Ahora, es una obligación para que no cambie de elemento, si se quiere. por mencionar solo unas cosas.
Hay muchas cosas que se cambiaron. Alatreon es un gran reto, pide toda tu concentración y mantener la guardia en alto. Ser cuidadoso pero efectivo y aprender del monstruo. he intentado ya más de 100 veces, unas cuantas en grupo, y el resto solo. puedo decir que es mucho más seguro ir solo. y vaya que he aprendido de su pelea. la perseverancia ante la frustración es una piedra angular para esta clase de juegos. no pueden expectar menos.

PD: encuentro que es una estupidez lo de nerfear a Alatreon por un puñado de personas que no son capaces de soportar el fracaso constante, en un juego que siempre ha sido de falla > aprendizaje > triunfo. querer todo más fácil ha vuelto a la gente demasiado cómoda.

72704385.review:
I plan on putting more time into this and honestly I'm still researching new monsters and unlocking new mechanics but at 60 hours I feel qualified to tell you this game is pretty damn great.

UPDATE 100 HOURS LATER:

Wow. Started Iceborne! The franchise reputation as king of clunk is well-earned and while I recommend it without a shadow of a doubt be prepared for menu hell and some user experience jank that shouldn't really exist. But this is still so insanely good!

To get the worst/only complaints out of the way:

- Co-op story quests - why must everybody load into a quest solo to view a cutscene then return to base so they can rejoin and head to the same area? Is MT Framework struggling that badly with networking? Don't even get me started on expeditions with objectives that block SOS flares. It's bizarre. 
- Frame-rate - this game isn't a looker really but you'd have a hard time telling a frame-rate graph that. It's a little hefty but 30 is always in reach and 60 is possible with visual compromise on my GTX 980 + i7-6700k. FidelityFX and DX12 help out a lot here. Heavy hitting settings are AO, LOD bias, MH diffuse quality, and of course image quality. Anybody on a 1070+ or 2000 series card need not worry, although DLSS isn't available on resolutions below 1440p for reasons beyond me.

Negativity out of the way, come into this expecting impenetrable mechanics and moderate difficulty and you'll continually be pleasantly surprised. Stamina based combat is not implemented in a souls-ian way despite that being the hot comparison of the moment when the game launched - attacks are free but dodges and sprinting are not. Positioning is everything and combo overcommitment is death. Combat and movement feel deceptively fluid, despite their heft!

Learning monsters' behavioural patterns through different encounters and seeing how they interact with environmental hazards as well as the other monsters allows you to get ahead in fights that may not be going in your favour. Research (or a good look at the wiki..) lets you plan elemental loadouts and complimentary armour skill builds to tackle each kind of enemy if you want to get into micro-management. Lots of fun almost-emergent gameplay here too, especially in the early hours of each new difficulty tier when avoiding certain monsters (*coughs in Anjanath, Bezelguese, Deviljho etc.*) as they conveniently find their way into the areas you're in, making encounters more unpredictable and satisfying to tackle. It's all really engaging stuff.

RNG drop tables in paid titles have always sat weirdly with me personally cause I'm always on edge due to the monetisation potential these kinds of looter gameplay loops have but I can safely say (for my own benefit if nobody else's) that there's nothing scummy going on here. Gnerally speaking, it's kind RNG too, not even factoring in the in-built tools given as login bonuses that allow you to manipulate the RNG of upcoming quests. Grinding for rare streamstones for weapon augments in the base late-game was a bit of a chore for sure, and I can't comment on Iceborne's equivalent mechanic yet, but it was never too bad and still provided  fun challenges as the difficulty scaled.

cannot be bothered to finish this and i'm sure people aren't bothered about reading it either so 
TL;DR excellent game runs bad has jank

- Hit boxes are fair.

72637252.review:
Um jogo que a muitos anos atrás não me chamava atenção nenhuma...até o momento que adquiri um New 3ds e comecei a jogar o Generations, joguei por cerca de 300hrs, cheguei ao end game fiz diversas quests do hub online com outras pessoas e migrei para o Double Cross(JPN) que é nada mais que uma continuação do generations só que em japones e com muito mais melhorias e conteúdo, o qual mais joguei cerca de 430hrs, dessas horas de gameplay pelo menos 300hrs foram apenas jogando de arco que é a minha arma preferida junto com a light bowgun. 

Agora sobre o MH World, fiz a pré venda do game no PS4 joguei até derrotar o  Xeno'jiiva fiz poucas quests do HUB e dropei para jogar outra coisa, depois de um bom tempo já com a nova expansão lançada e na promoção devido a sale comprei sem pensar duas vezes por que saberia que iria ter muita coisa pra fazer nele. Derrotei novamente o  Xeno'jiiva da história do jogo base e vim aqui dizer que o jogo ta uma delicia no pc a 60fps, chega a dar nojo a versão do PS4 que é a 30fps. 
Quando joguei no PS4 não tive ajuda das armaduras e armas defender, que foram inseridas no iceborne, que praticamente são as melhores coisas para se usar independente de elemento ou defesa do set. Terminei o jogo base no PC com cerca de 13hrs jogadas apenas de arco. Não troquei nem de arma, nem de set nenhuma vez até o presente momento já tendo derrotado o  Xeno'jiiva, então não perca seu tempo farmando sets do jogo base e de high rank. Se preocupe apenas em terminar o jogo base para avançar para finalmente a iceborne que conta com todo o conteúdo verdadeiro do end-game.

No mais, vale muito a pena comprar até se não estiver na promoção o jogo é muito grande e pode te oferecer mais de 100hrs fácil, fácil só farmando. É um dos poucos jogos de grind que consigo gostar de verdade.

72614317.review:
来聊一聊我对这款游戏的看法。首先，这毋庸置疑是一款好游戏，就如它的名字一样，你能在这款游戏里面体验到狩猎带来的乐趣。从初见怪物对它完全陌生，被追着打，再到经历了一次又一次的狩猎后逐渐变强，完全的了解怪物所有的招式把怪摁在地上摩擦，这种转变所带来的喜悦是无法替代的。（现在都还记得当初怎么都打不过王咩，但经过一次又一次的尝试后，逐渐理解自己手中的武器，和王咩的招式，并最终打败了王咩时所带来的那种成就感）武器方面，我自己主玩太刀[spoiler] 就是碰了这武器才大大延长了我的游戏寿命[/spoiler]（个人认为节奏感最好的武器），世界的太刀就是通过见切看破怪物招式然后反击，这种跟怪物之间建立互动的方式我是真的很喜欢。当然怪猎里的每把武器都有自己的特色，都是值得一玩的，像我的好友里就有弓箭玩的特别溜的，一局狩猎下来可能怪都摸不到他。

总的来说怪猎是一个十分值得一玩的游戏，相信我，当你真正体会到狩猎的乐趣之后，你也会对这游戏爱不释手的。虽然在冰原dlc之后它有了各种各样的缺点，什么肝的要素太多啊，逐渐网游化啊，怪物开始变粪啊，蜜汁勾爪判定啊，口水硬躲招啊[spoiler] 我大回旋TM又空了！ [/spoiler]，历战王台阶啊，但这些还是无法盖过它的优点的，它真的是目前为止做的最好的狩猎类型的游戏。

打了那么多的救援后，在聊一聊对新手的一些建议吧：
1.首先就是，请自己完成主线剧情的所有狩猎，放在主线的这些怪都是有理由的，你打不过很多时候不是因为你菜，而是你没想到怎么应对它，怪猎在这方面的机制是很成熟的，猎人的陷阱，环境里的落石，勾爪撞墙，你其实有很多处理怪物的方法的，只是你没去用而已，不要以为怪猎就只是一个一人一武器一怪物的硬钢游戏。打不过多打打或者去查查攻略什么的总能过的。
2.请尽量不要在主线未完成的情况下去使用什么修改器去修改伤害逃课，在没有主线的积累时，你会发现怎么你什么怪都打不过。特别是冰原这状况更加严重。
3.防卫队系列的防具能不用还是不用的好，它会影响狩猎体验的。
4.对于一些难度较高的怪，你叫了救援了也请不要只是看着不去打[spoiler] 打极贝救援就经常见到这种就搁营地呆着的，打完了也是什么也不说的 [/spoiler]，这样你还是打不过它，猫了又怎么样嘛，大不了再开一局嘛，大佬还是会来帮你的。

72586208.review:
If you're like me, you tend to judge your games by how many hours of enjoyment you get out of them compared to the total cost. Having paid about $100 for this game and its DLC, and having 800 hours of playtime on record (rounded down to cut out time spent with the game open and _not_ playing it), you'll quickly figure out that I paid about $0.12/hour for this experience, and I'm still enjoying it.

This is one of the most enjoyable grinds you will have in your life, barring a sequel coming out that blows it out of the water. It doesn't function like Destiny or Warframe where there's a small chance you'll get what you want/need once you finish a mission. Rather, there are ways to practically guarantee you get what you're looking for to build that piece of armor or that weapon. It's just a matter of finding the right mission.

World is a fun 60-80 hour romp that takes you from killing small, barely threatening beasts to continent-ending disasters of creation with nothing but one of fourteen trusty weapon types on your back. There's a small issue with Elemental damage - and by that I mean most of the weapon types don't benefit from it nearly as much as others. But if you're not super concerned with optimizing your damage as much as possible, this rarely comes up.

The game does a good job of telling you just enough about your target after fighting them one or two times to let you experiment and figure out the best way to approach them based on your choices. Should you use a ranged weapon for flying monsters, or is there a way to knock them to the ground so you can beat them up with a melee option you're more comfortable with? This monster doesn't take as much damage from Slicing damage, so should you try to bring in a blunt weapon? This monster causes status effects, so should I change my armor to get resistance to them or bring items that can negate them when eaten?

However, World also suffers from being pretty easy compared to other games in the franchise. If you're looking for a real challenge after conquering this title, Iceborne is the way to go. All the monsters return with new attack patterns and defenses, and new monsters also show their faces - effectively doubling the roster of the game. It definitely revitalizes the experience, and it tacks on another 30-40 hours of gameplay to the to boot.

If you like to analyze an opponent, learn how to approach them, frequently adapt your weapons and armor to best counter them, and succeed due to planning and practice, this is the game for you. If you like ripping pieces off your killed (or captured) prey and forging them into unique armors that provide a plethora of options for how you play the huge variety of weapon types, this game is for you. If you enjoy optimizing your loadout to see just how fast you can get a job done, theorycrafting fights, or subjecting huge creatures that once gave you a run for your money to five minute sessions of stunlock before forcing them to give up the ghost, this is the game for you.

I highly recommend everyone check this out. Capcom knocked it out of the park.

72506887.review:
Been waiting a while before I actually write the review. To be honest, I just forgot about it..
So now that Iceborne has been out for a while it seems like the perfect time.

I absolutely love this game and have these phases where I mostly only play this game for a month and then take a break. The grind, even with how rare some of the best gems are, is still extremely satisfying. And that moment you get that rare gem is just amazing.

The variety of weapons is enough to keep me entertained and have new stuff to learn/enjoy when I get tired of the current weapon I'm using.

The changes that came with Iceborne were mostly a great addition. While I'm not super happy with the clutch claw implementation I do like the idea behind it. The biggest issue I have is that the 'light' weapons don't soften parts instantly. With you having to refresh the parts, every 90 seconds I think it was? this gets annoying. Leaving aside the clutch claw the rest of the additions and quality of life features were a blessing. 

So, this has basically been a collection of random thoughts I had, TLDR big recommendation to anybody who enjoys a grind for >1% chances at getting the best gems, hope this potato review was helpful.

72412090.review:
Ever wanted to hunt the T-Rex from Jurassic Park with an oversize katana? Except that T-Rex shoots flaming snot at you when she gets mad about it?  Ever watch those godawful Hobbit movies and your favorite part was when Smaug died?  Have you ever played Dark Souls and wished you were fighting a peacock with a chameleon's face instead of the twisted manifestations of lost souls?  Have you seen a King Kong movie and thought to yourself, "I want to hit that gorilla in the face with a giant hammer?" All these things and more can happen to you with a one time purchase of *Current Price of Monster Hunter: World Here*

This Monsters in this game have incredible animalistic behaviors to make tracking them and mastering fighting them give you a sense of accomplishment much like the one you used to feel until your parents discovered you do that thing they don't approve of.  Your Palico companion shows you the adoration you desire from the real cats that just back off and hiss at you because THEY KNOW. You also get a pet pig that has a secret frog costume which is very cute. 

My only gripe about this game is its matchmaking.  It can be tough to get connected with your friend for some Monster Thrashing.  However I am writing this review at 30 hours (With another 40 back when vanilla released on PS4) and don't intend to stop anytime soon.

Best played with a controller and a lot of patience.

73295962.review:
MH:W is my first entry into the series despite knowing about it for a while. At its core, it is a game about hunting large monsters, getting their parts, making new weapons and armor, and repeating the cycle. I’ll admit that in my playtime, I have certainly gotten exhausted by this loop, but there are things that made me come back for more at a later date. This review is more casual than usual since there is a lot to cover and I am saving some things for my separate review for the Iceborne expansion which has overridden my memories of the vanilla game. 

[h1]THE GOOD[/h1]
Overall, the gameplay is excellent. Your Hunter (character) can equip a variety of armor pieces, weapons and decorations to create a unique character to embark on hunts with. Each monster feels unique, barring some subspecies/ variants that play largely the same as their parent monster. Even then, said subtypes have unique gimmicks that made me approach the fight differently and made fighting them interesting. 

There are 14 weapon types to choose from, each playing differently from one another. Thus, whenever I felt bored, I tried out a new weapon class to change my playstyle and tactics. There is bound to be at least one that speaks to you. Most attacks have weight to them so you have to commit to attacking and knowing when to strike. Monsters will happily attack you mid-combo so playing smart is always rewarded. Some weapons even reward smart plays like that such as the Longsword with its counter slash. 

To further this, there are multiple different skills you can invest in via armor and decorations and charms, giving you many customization options to change the way you play. 
Thus, the actual hunting in Monster Hunter: World is great. 


Sounds were also pretty great. Monsters sound distinct, music is varied from locales to monster themes, and sound effects sound right and satisfying.

There are also sone QoL improvements included such as having a farm where you can grow certain materials between missions. This makes it so that you can spend more time hunting and less time farming craftable items. 

[h1]THE NEUTRAL[/h1]
I was ultimately unimpressed by the story. I know its just an excuse to fight more monsters and contextualize why they are there, but I felt Capcom missed an opportunity to intertwine a good, meaningful story with the more primitive fun of slaying giant monsters. It served its purpose, but is honestly forgettable.

Graphics were also really great in terms of art direction, animation and execution. I love the way monsters look and move around. The environments are really beautiful and feel alive. However, I consistently drop frames when at High with a 1080 Ti so I have to sacrifice looks for performance, but more on that later. 

The player base/ community is a big mixed bag. I honestly met some cool people I became friends with over MH. However, I also had super whiny, annoying, and downright toxic players on hunts as well. Overall, my experience is neutral, but just keep in mind that World has a very big and active player base and temper your expectations accordingly. 

Some weapon and armor designs are really cool. Some are pretty bad. I heard that they wanted to go with a more “realistic” style of design, but the end result is pretty mixed. 

As an addendum to the gameplay, some hitboxes are just straight up broken in the bad way. Sometimes you’ll just barely get hit by a monster and still take full damage from an attack. However, I’ve also gotten some scummy hits in by the very same jank hitbox. 

Likewise, the only thing you do in this game is hunt. Although MH:W is kinda operated like an MMO with new free updates and events, there isn’t any real variety in what you can do in this game. You can go fishing or do a collection quest, but 99% of the time you’ll be fighting monsters. Thus I got tired of the game after some longer grinding sessions.

[h1]THE BAD[/h1]
Performance is really flaky in my playtime. I’ll include connectivity/ multiplayer here as it is a big part of the MH:W experience. Overall, I’ve had massive CPU, RAM and/or GPU usage over various stages of patches and updates since day 1. Capcom really needs to optimize their game better even if PC gaming isn’t their forte. Connectivity is the absolute worst as I have been dropped from quests or lobbies many times for no reason except for the servers being bad. For a game advertised as the “next gen” MH title (or current gen as of writing), there is a lot left to be desired in the performance department. 

End game grinding is super annoying. You still have to gamble on getting the right decorations after every mission. To explain more, there are different tiers of decorations that you can get at the end of every hunt. However, there are MANY skills per tier, so a player is very likely to get the same unneeded decoration every time they finish a quest (e.g. I have almost a hundred “Hungerless” Jewels but only around 5 “Attack Up” Jewels which are vastly more useful). Capcom has released decoration farming events, but you still roll the dice every time you clear a quest. Thus, you’ll frequently see memes about farming for hours only to get more junk. There is a system to recycle decorations, but I am unsure if that is due to the Iceborne expansion as I have sunk about 3/5 of my playtime with that and cannot recall vanilla that well. 

The camera is also pretty temperamental at times. I’ve died quite a few times because I couldn’t see anything due to bad angles, seeing out of world, etc.  

[h1]OVERALL[/h1]
I honestly stuck around for the hunting and camaraderie of helping others. The game does its core premise, hunting, well, so I am content with that. However, there are definitely aspects that drag down the experience but I was able to push past them. 

I’d say that the current price of $30 USD is fair, but if you are wary, please get it on sale.

完了，一切都完了。
首发入的玩了一百个小时，当时想开个男号捏脸但丁，没那么多时间，就开了修改器玩男号档，为了尽快到达等级去刷但丁装备，说白了就是自嗨一下。实在是不记得当时有没有用修改器给大号存档做过什么了，两年前的事情了。中间断了一百个小时，最近重新捡起来刷的不亦乐乎，废寝忘食。就当等明天的感谢祭继续玩的时候，就当这回玩了80个小时的时候，突然在某次任务回来以后卡死了，游戏内不能移动，电脑系统没有卡。

也怪不得谁，自己当年无知做的错，没想到在两年后才秋后算账。我更疑惑的是卡普空你TMD为什么这次之前让我刷了一百个小时冰原突然搞这么一出？养肥了再杀？太令我恶心了。

73622884.review:
Monster Hunter World é um jogo muito bom mas confesso que nunca cheguei perto dos títulos passados da franquia então não consigo dar uma analise sólida do nível de dificuldade do jogo em relação aos antigos mas enfim

O jogo é muito interessante e bem divertido já que o conceito de matar vários ''boss'' como se fossem inimigos normais foi bem inovador a primeira vista pra mim e achei muito interessante sem contar que o jogo me incentivou a testar títulos similares como God Eater e Dauntless mas de fato Monster Hunter é de longe um dos melhores que eu joguei. Em questão de gameplay tá mais puxado pra um Dark Souls-esque já que rola muito desvio no meio da caçada (mas nem de longe isso se compara de fato a Dark Souls).

O roster inicial de monstros é até certo ponto ''extenso''  mas comparado aos últimos jogos é muito pouco mas a expansão Iceborne dá uma aliviada 
Falando na tal expansão eu recomendo comprar ela se estiver interessado, o endgame é de fato muito melhorado e tem algumas mecânicas novas em questão das armas, sem contar nas inumeras melhorias de Quality of Life que foram feitas ao longo das atualizações do Iceborne. A expansão até agora está constantemente recebendo suporte e conteúdo novo como monstros, sistemas novos e etc.

É um jogo bem interessante até mesmo para newcomers na série Monster Hunter já que pelo menos pra mim está impossivel botar as mãos em um jogo mais antigo da série ( o mais proximo de um Monster Hunter antigo que dá pra comprar hoje em dia é o Generations Ultimate já que ele foi portado para Nintendo Switch)
No geral
Muito Bom, uso pra matar aula online

72770879.review:
This is just for Monster Hunter: World and does not reflect the state of the game in the Iceborne Expansion.  However, it is for v14.0.0 which is well after the release of Iceborne.

Monster Hunter: World (MHW) is my first, and only, experience with the series.  I bought it on a whim during one of Steam's many sales and have not regretted it a bit.  In fact, a good friend of mine plays it on PS4 and to play online with him I bought it there, too.  At full price.

The TL;DR of MHW is that it is a co-op fighter for old farts.  Each weapon gives you a different move set.  Each map has several environments.  But at it's core it feels like a fighting game where the opponent is not another character, but a monster several times your size.  You can fight the monsters mono e monstero, if you must.  But the game shines when you go in with 1-3 other hunters.  Many of the fights are satisfying to finish, even when you've faced the monster dozens of times.  This is because the game never really gives you weapons that grossly overpower the monsters, with a few rare exceptions.

Is it possible to completely decimated the monsters?  Yes, there are speed runners that perform such feats.  But those are for the practiced and dedicated players.  For an old fart like me, I'm content to farm up materials for the next armor/weapon set, and have a good evening hunting monsters with my friends.  The game truly caters to both audiences.

I know Steam will say I have something like 90 hours into the game as of this writing; but that doesn't count the nearly 500 hours I've invested in the PS4 edition of the game.  The PC port is generally good.  The Iceborne launch left it in a bit of a mess, but since then it has stabilized and I've put in a couple of dozen hours in the base game of MHW since the expansion's release.

Overall, this is a solid game.  Especially if you love co-op titles.

73709163.review:
With more than 500 hours across both the Ps4 and Steam versions, and 1000 across the series, this game is absolutely my favorite. Capcom has set itself so distantly apart from other developers by taking a game that relies heavily on aesthetic and stylistic elements by not relying on cosmetic micro-transactionary bullshit and just cranking all of these elements up to 11. MHW is challenging, fun, exciting, beautiful, and full of so many different armor sets, weapon sets, skills, and ways of playing that anyone who is a fan of action games, RPG-like games, or just well designed and polished games, should do themselves a favor and pick this up.

Quick note: it is a rather obtuse and challenging game, as previously stated, so it takes a bit to get used to. However, overcoming that initial hurdle will quickly become a forgotten experience.

73512420.review:
八百多小时了，该给mhwi写点东西了。我点了不推荐，不是因为游戏本身有什么问题，游戏是好游戏，是少见的佳作，在mh史上是里程碑式的作品。但是如果真的有别的朋友入手，我觉得你还是需要认真考虑一下。
首先，排除大部分的本体怪，历战王或是冰原的怪物难度都不低，没有一定游戏基础的人接触时会很难受，没有大佬带的话通关都成问题（对，单机萌新玩家谨慎入手）
其次，依旧是从本体就延续到冰原的问题——宝珠，对于这项，想必玩过的各位都清楚，没有个几百小时怕是肝不出自己想要的珠子
再次，mhwi的各项优化实在叫人不敢恭维，先不说频繁的掉线问题，单单钩爪机制就把无数玩家气的直骂娘，以至于生态总监藤冈要先生一直在背锅（台阶是你的锅这个没跑嗷）
最后，也有不少玩家对游戏繁琐的机制劝退，主线，隐藏任务，解禁任务，聚魔之地，大大小小的后续配信也让想要入手冰原的萌新望而却步（当然了这可能是个人问题）
说了这么多，你问我那为什么我还在玩mhwi？
因为，它是怪物猎人，它就在这里，等着我去把它完结。
